title: Bug 31627 - Core Dump Issue When Changing Perspective with DBCS Project
description: This bug report pertains to a problem where a core dump occurs upon attempting to switch perspectives in Eclipse after adding a DBCS (Double-Byte Character Set) project to the workspace. The issue is encountered in an environment with the following specifications: EclipseSDKI20030211 on RedHat 8 with GTK 2.2, Japanese locale (jaJP.eucJP), and IBM JDK 1.3.1 + SR3.
OB: The observed behavior section is currently missing specific details about what happens when this core dump issue occurs. Please provide a detailed description of the software's behavior when this problem is encountered.
EB: The expected behavior is that changing perspectives, particularly when selecting the 'Resource Perspective' icon, should be successful without any core dumps or errors.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a project using DBCS characters (e.g., 'あいうえお' in Unicode).
2. Right-click on the project and select 'Team' > 'Share Project...'
3. Select the CVS repository.
4. Choose the option 'Use project name as module name' and click 'Finish.'
5. Select the project in the Synchronize view.
6. Right-click on the project and choose 'Add Version Control.'
7. Right-click on the project and select 'Commit.'
8. Right-click on the project and select 'Delete' (Choose 'also delete contents under the /workspace folder name').
9. Change the perspective to the 'CVS Perspective.'
10. Expand the repository and HEAD.
11. Right-click on the DBCS project and select 'Check Out As Project.'
12. Additional steps beyond this point are not provided in the original report.
